'''Ravindra Khattree''' (born 1959) is an [[India]]n-born [[statistician]] and [[professor]] of [[statistics]] at [[Oakland University]]. His contribution to the Fountain–Khattree–Peddada Theorem in [[Pitman closeness criterion|Pitman measure of closeness]] is one of the important results of his work.<ref>Kotz, S., Johnson, N. R. and Banks, D., “Chapter: Pitman Measure of Closeness", ''Encyclopedia of Statistical Sciences'', Update Volume 1, pages 457–458 1997”</ref> Khattree is the coauthor of two books and has coedited two volumes. He has served as an associate editor of the ''[[Communications in Statistics]]'' journal and the editor of the ''Interstat'' online journal. He is Chief editor of ''Journal of Statistics and Applications''. He is an elected fellow of the [[American Statistical Association]].<ref name="Samoray">Jeff Samoray, [http://www4.oakland.edu/view_news.aspx?sid=34&id=210 "Professor elected ASA fellow"], News Release, Oakland University, September 8, 2003</ref>

Khattree was born in [[Uttar Pradesh, India]]. He attended the [[Ewing Christian College]]-[[Allahabad University]] and the [[Indian Statistical Institute]]. In 1985, he earned a doctorate from the [[University of Pittsburgh]] with [[Calyampudi Radhakrishna Rao]] as his advisor. He became a faculty member at Oakland University in 1991. He was the biostatistics group leader in the Biomedical Research and Informatics Center and a professor of biostatistics in the College of Human Medicine, Michigan State University during 2005–2006. He worked as a senior research scientist at US [[United States National Academy of Sciences|National Academy of Sciences]] with assignment at the Radiation Effects Research Foundation (formerly known as [[Atomic Bomb Casualty Commission]]), Hiroshima during 2010–2011.<ref name="Samoray"/>

Prior to joining Oakland University, he had been a faculty member at the [[North Dakota State University]], [[Case Western Reserve University]] and also worked at BFGoodrich Chemical Group. He is the paternal grandson of [[Binda Prasad Khattri]].

==Recognition==
In 2002, Khattree received the Young Researcher Award from the [[International Indian Statistical Association]].<ref name="www4.oakland.edu">[http://www4.oakland.edu/view_news.aspx?sid=34&id=4625 "Research Excellence Award"], News release, Oakland University, April 16, 2008</ref> Khattree was honored with fellowship in the [[American Statistical Association]] in 2003 and became an elected member of the [[International Statistical Institute]] in 2004.<ref>[http://www4.oakland.edu/view_news.aspx?sid=34&id=2166 "OU professor named to international society"], Press release, Oakland University, October 27, 2004</ref> He is also a recipient of Oakland University Research Excellence Award (2008).
